content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    pattern = r"```julia\n((?:\s|[\S])*)```"
    # Replace all matches with the content inside the code block
    content = replace(md, pattern => s"\1")
    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from each line
    cleaned_content = map(strip, split(content, "\n"))
    # Join the lines back together with a newline
    joined_content = join(cleaned_content, "\n")
    return joined_content
end
```

This function works by first using a regular expression to match all ````julia` code blocks within the Markdown document. It then replaces each match with the content inside the code block without the surrounding triple backticks. After that, it strips leading and trailing whitespace from each line in the content and finally joins them together with newlines.
